name: FortifyReport
description: Fetches and displays Fortify SSC vulnerability reports in Azure DevOps build results
author: Santhosh Kumar

inputs.name: sscUrl
inputs.label: Fortify SSC URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The URL of your Fortify SSC instance (e.g., https://your-ssc-instance.com or http://52.67.113.58:8080/ssc)

inputs.name: ciToken
inputs.label: CI Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Your Fortify SSC CI token for authentication. **Tip:** Store this in a secure variable or Azure Key Vault for security.

inputs.name: appName
inputs.label: Application Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the application in Fortify SSC. This must match exactly with the application name in SSC.

inputs.name: appVersion
inputs.label: Application Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: Version of the application in Fortify SSC. This must match exactly with the version name in SSC.

inputs.name: maxIssues
inputs.label: Maximum Issues
inputs.helpMarkDown: Maximum number of issues to fetch from Fortify SSC. Default is 10,000. Increase this value if your application has more issues than the default limit.

inputs.name: skipValidation
inputs.label: Skip Connection Validation
inputs.helpMarkDown: Skip validation of Fortify SSC connection and application/version during task execution. Enable this if you're experiencing network issues or want faster execution.

messages.ConnectionFailed: Failed to connect to Fortify SSC: %s
messages.ApplicationNotFound: Application '%s' not found in Fortify SSC
messages.ReportConfigured: Fortify report configured successfully for %s v%s
